Others: Jimmy Butler exited the game between the Miami Heat and Denver Nuggets due to an ankle injury.
Butler slipped on a drive to the basket and left the game shortly after, with the Heat announcing his absence for the night.
The Heat trailed 40-27 at the end of the first quarter, with Butler playing only six minutes.
The Heat are struggling at 3-5, and their chances of a revival on this road trip with four games left seem bleak.
The Nuggets beat the Heat 135-122 on Friday.
The Heat struggled to contain Denver, despite keeping the pressure up offensively.
Tyler Herro scored 24 points, while Bam Adebayo and Duncan Robinson had 20 each for the Heat.
The Heat have struggled with injuries in the Jimmy Butler era, with only four players playing at least 75 games.
The Heat have been a top-six team only twice with Butler, and they have been in the play-in tournament three times.
Butler's injury struggles have been a key reason behind their lack of regular-season success.
The Heat hoped that would change this year, but it doesn't seem to be the case.
The former All-Star has already suffered his first injury of the year after eight games, and Miami dropped to 3-5.
The lottery teams in the Eastern Conference, like the Brooklyn Nets, Detroit Pistons, and Atlanta Hawks, have played much better in that span, threatening Miami's chances of making the postseason.

There's no update available on Jimmy Butler's potential long-term absence, but looking at video replays suggests it could be a multi-game absence for a week or two, depending on the severity of the sprain.
Jimmy Butler's health has been pivotal for the Heat in recent years, with their deepest playoff runs coming with the star player healthy.
That included Butler leading the 2023 eight-seeded Miami to the finals.
